title: Holiest sites in Islam
summary: The four holiest sites in Islam are the Kaaba inside the Masjid al-Haram in Mecca as the holiest of the four, followed by Al-Masjid an-Nabawi in Medina, Al-Aqsa Mosque in Jerusalem and the Umayyad Mosque in Damascus; these sites are accepted in this order by the overwhelming majority of Islamic sects which are all held in high esteem.[2][3][4][5][6] The two holiest sites of Mecca and Medina in Saudi Arabia are directly mentioned or referred to in the Quran.[1][7][8][9][2][10]
